attributes.action: Raise State Benefits for Single People who are long term sick
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
At present the benefits section does not take into account single people who do not have children or dependants.

Single people have the same overheads to live as those that are married.

Single people who are long term sick are not eligible for extra benefits.

In the current climate of high food and fuel costs, single people without children will suffer the indignity of not being able to heat their homes and feed themselves. They will have to choose between heating or eating.

This petition is to bring this to the attention of the Prime Minister, in the hope that some kind of benefit can be put in place for single childless people.

At present a single person who cannot work due to long term illness has to survive on just over £2,000 per year. The poverty line is £15,000 per year.

If you are also in the same position, and cannot survive on your benefits, please take the time to sign this petition, in the hope that the Government will adjust benefits to take into consideration those of us who cannot survive on £60 a week.
